CatDescriptText: Maryann Zahradnik, nurse, Oakland and Angelo Milburn, shoe clerk, North Side were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 22, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think Negro voters consider local or national issues in the casting of their votes?" Mrs. Zahradnik's answer reads: "National issues, because segregation is a national problem and the voter considers this when he casts his vote."  Mr. Milburn's answer reads: "On the national issues, because you don't have problems here like the crisis in the South."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Maryann Zahradnik wearing light colored shirt dress, standing in front of two men and buildings; Portrait of Angelo Milburn wearing striped bow tie and eyeglasses, standing in front of store with signs, and pedestrians
